snippet: The Obama administration has signaled its disfavor for Uhuru Kenyatta, accused of war crimes, who was ahead in presidential balloting. But rejecting him could harm ties to a vital ally.
abstract: Obama administration has signaled its disfavor for Kenyan presidential candidate Uhuru Kenyatta, who is ahead in balloting, but rejecting him could harm ties to a vital ally;  he has been charged with war crimes by International Criminal Court at The Hague; United States must be careful in handling Kenyatta issue, because he could easily turn to China, which has made important inroads in country.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration has signaled its disfavor for Uhuru Kenyatta, accused of war crimes, who was ahead in presidential balloting. But rejecting him could harm ties to a vital ally.

headline.seo: Uhuru Kenyatta’s Lead in Voting Poses Tough Choices for U.S.-Kenya Relations
headline.main: Leader of Vote Count in Kenya Faces U.S. With Tough Choices
headline.print_headline: Kenya Election May Offer U.S. Tough Choice

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
